column4: how do i install all packages LIKE "foo-1 foo-2 foo-3" in one "foo-*" ???
yeah, I think that works
it does not
I just tried it
'sudo apt-get -s install gtk*' gave me a long list of selections
but it does not install them!
it gives you suggestions
I don't think so, let me find something i can try without messing up my box
r-cran-*
that's a lot of stuff
0 upgraded, 76 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded.
how did you do it?
how did you write the command?
sudo apt-get -s install r-cran-*, you take off the '-s' since that means simulate
aptitude install r-cran-* dfoes not work
use apt-get, seems to work there
i want to use aptitude!
what's the difference!, you probably need to read man aptitude to see how it handles it then
# aptitude install 'r-cran-~n' <-- '~n' is the wildcard for aptitude
ah I see, seems dumb to me to introduce new schemes, but ok
yeah * would be nicer
